full.title: Case Report: Mediastinal Mass in SARS-COV-2 Pandemic: A Word of Caution.
full.authorString: Baisi A, Mazzucco A, Caffarena G, Cioffi G, Guttadauro A, Cioffi U.

authorAffiliation.affiliation: Thoracic Surgery Unit, University of Milan-ASST Santi Paolo e Carlo, Milan, Italy.
Thoracic Surgery Unit, University of Milan-ASST Santi Paolo e Carlo, Milan, Italy.
Thoracic Surgery Unit, University of Milan-ASST Santi Paolo e Carlo, Milan, Italy.

Department of Surgery, University of Milan, Milan, Italy.

full.abstractText: Background: SARS-CoV-2 is a new disease with some manifestations not yet well-known. Sharing experiences in this topic is crucial for the optimal management of the patients. Case Presentation: Left upper extremity deep vein thrombosis (UEDVT) due to a mediastinal mass strongly suspected of lymphoproliferative disease in a patient affected by SARS-CoV-2, disappearing at the resolution of the viral infection. Conclusion: Before proceeding to surgical biopsy, mediastinal mass in SARS-CoV-2 patients must be revaluated after the resolution of the infection.
full.affiliation: Thoracic Surgery Unit, University of Milan-ASST Santi Paolo e Carlo, Milan, Italy.

abstract: Background: SARS-CoV-2 is a new disease with some manifestations not yet well-known. Sharing experiences in this topic is crucial for the optimal management of the patients. Case Presentation: Left upper extremity deep vein thrombosis (UEDVT) due to a mediastinal mass strongly suspected of lymphoproliferative disease in a patient affected by SARS-CoV-2, disappearing at the resolution of the viral infection. Conclusion: Before proceeding to surgical biopsy, mediastinal mass in SARS-CoV-2 patients must be revaluated after the resolution of the infection.
title: Case Report: Mediastinal Mass in SARS-COV-2 Pandemic: A Word of Caution.
